messages: c4d3b2d11fb141e1ff4da988453f1b13 (13:11): hello
c4d3b2d11fb141e1ff4da988453f1b13 (13:11): I accidently deleted the rom of my external hard drive enclosure
c4d3b2d11fb141e1ff4da988453f1b13 (13:11): and idea how to upload it again
c4d3b2d11fb141e1ff4da988453f1b13 (13:12): or is it dead forever now?
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:13): this might sound silly, but do wireless mics exist? that support linux ?
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:13): mics = microphones
ac4af998947102f0adce14f13d55438a (13:25): wireless mics ain't cheap tho
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (13:27): you can certainly get ones that are used in stagework, but those are unweildy, expensive, large, etc.
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (13:27): I've never seen a wireless computer mic
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:27): xushi: you mean a USB RF reciver with mic?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:28): if so there's a few firewire ones but be expecting to pay upwards of 190¬£
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:30): forget it.. i was thinking some ~10 pound one so that i can use it in the living room
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:31): otherwise, one with a ~5 meter chord could also do it
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:31): you're talking about pro quality and you require a local range broacast licence to use them...
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:31): my pc is connected to the tv on one end of the room
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:32): i just want some mic to use while sitting on the other end, so that i can skype
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:32): instead of get up and stand right next to the tv
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:32): mic pre-amp and send line level to your PC?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:33): line level will be decent over shit cables to 50m or so...
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:33): PC mics probablly won't be too good over about 2m of half decent cable
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:33): d you think i can find a cheap ~5 quid mic to connect to the mic/line in with a ~5 meter cord ?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:33): (I'm guessing on the PC mics0
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:33): ah, you just answered
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:34): a POS, pro wise, remote mic pre-amp will cost about 10¬£
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:35): StoneNewt: do you have any image or link about it? i don't think i heard about it before
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:35): not to hand..
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:35): they're called all kidns of things cause you don't do that kinda thing normally...
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:37): http://www.behringer.com/MA400/index.cfm?lang=ENG
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:37): but that's a good one
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:37): opps
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:38): http://www.behringer.com/PP400/index.cfm?lang=ENG
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:38): http://www.dv247.com/invt/34412/
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:38): oh, so just a typical audio amplifier you connect between your mic and the input of the pc
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:39): one thing of note is that's reltivly good quality kit and will be expecting decent mics on the end!
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:40): but it gives you an idea of what to look for
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:40): yea, that helps alot. thanks StoneNewt.
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (13:41): oh yeah if you have earthing problems Beringer Super DI20 are really nice piece of kit for the money
2e908e9004cdcf9ef83bd95245450381 (13:47): mm, i like behringer
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (14:06): cheap and decent quality... low end pro stuff and it's all rock solid ready for abuse
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (14:08): if I were to kit a studio out they'd be way down my list but if I wanted to get a half decent stage kit they'd be the first on my list...
